thread.title: Bosworth's College Football Hall of Fame journey continues Saturday
thread.title_full: Bosworth's College Football Hall of Fame journey continues Saturday | Dallas Morning News

author: Tommy Cummings
title: Bosworth's College Football Hall of Fame journey continues Saturday
text:
The College Football Hall of Fame tour is about to begin for Brian Bosworth.
The former Oklahoma and Irving MacArthur star will be recognized with an "On-Campus Salute" Saturday during the Sooners' Big 12 game against West Virginia in Norman, Okla.
The salute will occur between the first and second quarters.
The "On-Campus Salute" program allows College Football Hall of Fame inductees to return to their alma mater to accept a plaque to remain on permanent display at the school.
Bosworth, who was born in Oklahoma City, led Oklahoma to a national championship in 1985 after a 13-tackle performance against Penn State in the Orange Bowl. He was a two-time All-America and three-time all-conference selection. He finished fourth in the 1986 Heisman Trophy voting. He was also a three-time Academic All-America.
"It's a dream come true for me because I was an Oklahoma boy, and I got to live a dream and play at a university that had such a great tradition of great players," Bosworth said in January at a news conference announcing his induction.
Bosworth, 50, spent three seasons with the Seattle Seahawks. He has worked in acting and real estate since retirement. Last year, Dallas native Thaddeus D. Matula directed an ESPN Films' 30 For 30 series on Bosworth called Brian And The Boz .
Looking forward to celebrating the 1985 National Championship team at this weekend's @OU_Football game pic.twitter.com/8c3dgQKv2n
